thread.title: Super Mario Bros is 30 and Nintendo names a new president - but it's not who you'd think

author: Jeff Parsons
title: Super Mario Bros is 30 and Nintendo names a new president - but it's not who you'd think
text:
The President's chair at Japanese game giant Nintendo has remained empty since Satoru Iwata unexpectedly died in July this year .
Now the venerable company has named Tatsumi Kimishima as the new man in charge - a name unfamilar to many video game fans .
Many would have suspected Shigeru Miyamoto, the designer behind mega-hits like Mario, the Legend of Zelda and Donkey Kong as the next choice.
Instead Nintendo went for Kimishima, 65, who was most recently the managing director and head of human resources at the company.
Tatsumi Kimishima has been named the new president of Nintendo
He takes the reins at an interesting time for the company. It's most recent console, the Wii U, has failed to sell as well as the Xbox One or PS4 .
Nintendo is also experimenting with video games on smartphones for the first time .
GETTY Shigeru Miyamoto speaks during a news conference after the unveiling of the new game console Wii U at the Electronic Entertainment Expo
And, capping it all off, the company's seminal game Super Mario Bros, celebrated its 30th birthday on Sunday, September 13.
First launched in Japan in 1985 as part of Nintendo's Family Computer, the game features two plumbers, Mario and Luigi, on a quest to save a princess in captivity. It was named "the greatest game of all time" by San Francisco-based Imagine Games Network in 2005.
Is Mario the greatest video game character of all time?
The company has now created a website - in Japanese only - featuring three decades of the game's evolvement for fans to look back on.
Mario and Luigi have become one of the best-known characters of video game history, with their distinctive moustache and overalls.
Back where it all started
In a video uploaded to Nintendo's website on September 9th, the company celebrates the characters' 30 years with tributes made by fans around the world.
Super Mario Bros was developed as a sequel to Mario Bros., which began in 1983, and has sold more than 30 million copies worldwide.
It's original format features pixelated, two dimensional characters, but has continuously evolved into 30 different series throughout the years, and into its current three-dimensional form.
Super Mario Maker lets you build your own levels
Nintendo released a new version of the game on September 11 to celebrate three decades of history.
For the first time, the new game, called "Super Mario Maker," allows players to build personalized levels for each other to play in.
